However, this post mentioned a rather ugly method, that is to wrap them in a header file and mark them as static.

Yes, but then we'll end up with a copy of the kernel every time it's instantiated. Maybe this won't add too many extra duplicates (because it's already a template that is being instantiated per use site) but it seems a bit dangerous. But it might still be worth a try (and we can see how much binary size increases.)
